abstract: A factor between the initial size and the estimated physical size.
overview:
## Discussion

The default value is 1.0, which means that a version of this image that ARKit recognizes in the physical environment exactly matches its reference image [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARReferenceImage/physicalSize].

Otherwise, ARKit automatically corrects the image anchor’s transform when `estimatedScaleFactor` is a value other than 1.0. This adjustment in turn, corrects ARKit’s understanding of where the image anchor is located in the physical environment.

See [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARWorldTrackingConfiguration/automaticImageScaleEstimationEnabled].

# estimatedScaleFactor

**Instance Property**

A factor between the initial size and the estimated physical size.

## Declaration

```swift
var estimatedScaleFactor: CGFloat { get }
```

## Discussion

The default value is 1.0, which means that a version of this image that ARKit recognizes in the physical environment exactly matches its reference image [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARReferenceImage/physicalSize].

Otherwise, ARKit automatically corrects the image anchor’s transform when `estimatedScaleFactor` is a value other than 1.0. This adjustment in turn, corrects ARKit’s understanding of where the image anchor is located in the physical environment.

See [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARWorldTrackingConfiguration/automaticImageScaleEstimationEnabled].
title: estimatedScaleFactor
